instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.P3V42_G3H: What is P3V42_G3H? P3V42_G3H is a typo of PP3V42_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - AHT says ok, system boots.... but dies if going into sleep
threads.message:
(This is the same laptop as: [URL="https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/22185-solved-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-missing-<SIGNAL>P3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>"]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards...sing-<SIGNAL>P3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>[/URL])

History: Replaced <RESISTOR>R6995</RESISTOR>. L6995 and <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>, pulled a wire to <RESISTOR>R6995</RESISTOR> (Pin 1, <SIGNAL>PVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H</SIGNAL>) and the system booted again.

EFI AHT gives passed, normal AHT gives passed. System works fine (Although maybe a bit slow? But that could be since I'm only used to HDDs. Its usable though) and keeps on working fine until you put it into sleep by either pressing sleep or closing the lid.

Going from S0 into S5 works fine, going into S3 seems to cause issues though. It says in S0 with the CPU getting hotter and hotter.

Where to even start looking? I never had an issue like this before
Cheers

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - AHT says ok, system boots.... but dies if going into sleep
threads.message: Could pretty much be corrosion anywhere. Corrosion under SMC is common, but anything is possible :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - AHT says ok, system boots.... but dies if going into sleep
threads.message:
Possibly some dirt under the SMC, a good reflow with a fair amount of flux fixed the issue.

I'll be checking it couple of times to see if it keeps working even after it cooled down for a day before I give it back

Thanks
